text: William Blair (31 July 1820, Dundonald, Scotland – 13 July 1880, Waukesha, Wisconsin)Obituary in the Waukesha Freeman of July 15, 1880 (at finadagrave.com) was a member of the Wisconsin State Senate three times. First, from 1864 to 1865, second, from 1872 to 1873 and third, from 1876 to 1887. Additionally, he was President of the Waukesha, Wisconsin Board. His former home, now known as the Sen. William Blair House, is listed on the National Register of Historic Places. ==References== Category:1820 births Category:1880 deaths Category:Mayors of places in Wisconsin Category:People from South Ayrshire Category:Politicians from Waukesha, Wisconsin Category:Scottish emigrants to the United States Category:Wisconsin state senators Category:19th-century American politicians
title: William Blair (American politician)
